title: [BUG] mlflow run MLproject failed but same python command worked

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: We believe it is useful, but donâ€™t see it being prioritized in the next few months.

body:
### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
Ubuntu VERSION="18.04.2 LTS (Bionic Beaver)"

- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: 
pip

- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:
1.2.0

- **Python version**: 
3.6


### Describe the problem

I have set up a **MLproject** like this


```
name: Same as project folder name

conda_env: conda.yaml

entry_points:
  main:
    command: "python some.py -p some.json"
```

when I execute "`mlflow run /project folder/`", I always get some error like 

 ```
 File "/home/miniconda/bin/mlflow", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/cli.py", line 137, in run
    run_id=run_id
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 266, in run
    use_conda=use_conda, storage_dir=storage_dir, synchronous=synchronous, run_id=run_id)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 94, in _run
    active_run = _create_run(uri, experiment_id, work_dir, entry_point)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 622, in _create_run
    active_run = tracking.MlflowClient().create_run(experiment_id=experiment_id, tags=tags)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 88, in create_run
    tags=[RunTag(key, value) for (key, value) in iteritems(tags)]
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/rest_store.py", line 153, in create_run
    response_proto = self._call_endpoint(CreateRun, req_body)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/rest_store.py", line 64, in _call_endpoint
    response = self._verify_rest_response(response, endpoint)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/rest_store.py", line 47, in _verify_rest_response
    return verify_rest_response(response, endpoint)
  File "/home/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 84, in verify_rest_response
    raise RestException(json.loads(response.text))
mlflow.exceptions.RestException: INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: experiment_id must be set to a non-zero value
```

however, when I directly execute the python command in MLproject command "python some.py -p some.json", it works and can correctly log stuff into my MLflow server in Azure data bricks

anything wrong with MLproject? and do I use it in correct way?

Thanks
Rui
